name: Focus on Part L
location: This stream will take place in (room to be confirmed)
description: Part L 2013 is a step towards Part L 2016, which will require all new homes to be zero carbon and Part L 2019 which will require all buildings to be zero carbon. This session will explore progress to date and how to most effectively meet the performance standards required.

presentations.name: 2013 Part L - an introduction to the changes. Outline of the planned changes and the impact of these for domestic, non domestic and refurbishment
presentations.speakers: Dan Jestico, Head of Research and Development, Hilson Moran

presentations.name: The reality gap - differences between achieving standards and achieving a sustainable building
presentations.speakers: Huw Blackwell, Executive Sustainability Consultant, Hoare Lea

presentations.name: What are the most challenging aspects of the regulations for domestic buildings?
What will be the most challenging aspects of the regulations for non-domestic buildings?
presentations.speakers: Dr Paul Toyne, Group Head of Sustainability, WSP
